intro: Cybianthus comatus, commonly known as the hairy beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring full sun and well-drained soil. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Cybianthus comatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
